name: Polished Eggs
author: SUE
summary: These hardboiled eggs are soaked in a soy sauce and garlic mixture until dark. Serve with a small salad.
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan, and cover completely with cold water
Bring water to a boil for one minute
Cover, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water, and cool
Score spirals into the white of the eggs, from the tops to the bottoms, using a sharp knife
In a small saucepan, heat oil
Add garlic, and cook over medium heat until it begins to brown
Stir in sugar and soy sauce
Place eggs in sauce, and turn to coat
When eggs are nice and dark, and the sauce is thick and syrupy, remove from sauce
